column4: I need somebody with a brain to help me, i've followed the nvidia install guide but I Get an error saying the kernals are diffrent or something but yet it says my card is compatable with 7.04 so wth how do I fix this error, I keep having to go back to vesa to fix it. Please help
i've always had great luck with "envy" for graphics drivers, although it's not officially supported
But I want my nvidia installed >.<
I don't understand.
Nvidia GeForce 8800 GTX I need its driver installed
Yes, and i've allways had great luck with envy.
Your making no sence
That grabs the right drivers for the card, in this case 'nvidia', installs the nvidia-settings pannel, and mods your xorg.conf to use the new drivers
http://albertomilone.com/ubuntu/nvidia/scripts/envy_0.9.7-0ubuntu8_all.deb just open that file, and synaptic/packagemanager will install for you
What do I do when its installed?
run envy from apps>system tools>envy. you can also get a terminal interface with "sudo envy" at the terminal
Thanks, where can I find this if I ever have to re-install linux, I know I won't remember that link lol
albertomilone.com
or, of course, a google search for "envy nvidia graphics drivers ubuntu" or something like that
Thanks esteth, you've been a BIG help
np. as a word of caution, you should backup your /etc/X11/xorg.conf before you run envy, in case you end up unable to boot X
It installed my drivers and stuff perfectly, but how do I get more resoultion, im capped at 1024x768
bring up a terminal and type "gksudo nvidia-settings"
then the section called "X Server Display Configuration", and there should be a setting for resolution
Once again good job ^^ yay for you
Any idea why my Adobe Flash player download is sooooooo slow?
I'm not sure. If it's only the flash player downlad that's slow, you might just be downloading from a slow server.
Have you seen Beryl or Compiz Fusion how they can like manually twist the cube and the cube has a background, any idea how to do that?

http://forlong.blogage.de/article/2007/8/26/The-best-way-to-install-Compiz-Fusion-on-Ubuntu-Feisty looks good for getting compiz up and running, i followed a different howto, but i can't find it right now
